metadata.title: CVE-2023-52600 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: jfs:fix uaf in jfs_evict_inode When the execution of diMount(ipimap) fails, theobject ipimap that has been released may be accessed in diFreeSpecial().Asynchronous ipimap release occurs when rcu_core() calls jfs_free_node().Therefore, when diMount(ipimap) fails, sbi->ipimap should not beinitialized as ipimap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-253-generic - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-253-generic - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-253-lowlatency - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1130-aws - 4.4.0-1130.136
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1176-azure - 4.15.0-1176.191~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.136').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.191~14.04.1').
